data.enText: to formally suggest that sb should be chosen for an important role, prize, position, etc.

data.chText: 她已经获得了董事长职位的提名。
data.enText: She has been nominated for the presidency.

data.chText: 他获得了最佳男演员的提名。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语
动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to choose sb to do a particular job

data.chText: 我被任命为委员会委员。
data.enText: I have been nominated to the committee.

data.chText: 她被指派代表我们发言。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She was nominated to speak on our behalf.

data.chText: 挑选，指定（时间、日期、名称等）
data.enText: to choose a time, date or title for sth
1 December has been nominated as the day of the election.

simple_means.memory_skill: nomin 名称，名字 + ate 表动词 → 提名；任命

means: 挑选，指定(时间、日期、名称等)

ex.chText: 她被任命为约克市邮政局局长。
ex.enText: She was appointed (as) postmaster of the city of York.

ex.chText: 我们委派他为委员会成员。
ex.enText: We appointed him to the committee.

synonyms.bx: 指不经投票选举等而直接指派。常可与介词 as 连用，但现在经常将其省略。

ex.chText: 他选定了谁当他的副手？
ex.enText: Who has he designated (as) his deputy?

ex.chText: 她被选派接任财务主管的职务。
ex.enText: She was designated to take over the position of treasurer.

synonyms.bx: 通常指为某项工作或某个目的而任命，多用被动语态。

ex.enText: The president named her (as) Secretary of the State.

ex.chText: 她30岁的时候被主席选入该委员会。
ex.enText: At the age of 30, she was named to the committee by the chairman.

synonyms.bx: 指由官方选定某人或某物，尤指使其担任重要职务，常可与介词 as 连用，但现在经常将其省略。

ex.chText: 下月史密斯先生退休，布朗先生将获任命接替他的职位。
ex.enText: Next month Mr. Smith will retire and Mr. Brown will be nominated as his replacement.

ex.chText: 她被任命为委员会委员。
ex.enText: She was nominated to the committee.

synonyms.bx: 既可指提出人选，由有决策权的人定夺，也可指直接委任，常后接介词 as/to。

tr: propose as a candidate for some honor
create and charge with a task or function

example: She was named Head of the Committee
She was made president of the club

tr: nominate for appointment to an office or for an honor or position
example: The President nominated her as head of the Civil Rights Commission

value.def: If someone is nominated for a job or position, their name is formally suggested as a candidate for it.

example.ex: Under party rules each candidate has to be nominated by 55 Labour MPs...
example.tran: 根据党章，每个候选人必须得到55名工党下院议员的提名。

example.ex: The public will be able to nominate candidates for awards such as the MBE.
example.tran: 公众将可以推荐诸如英帝国勋章之类的奖项的候选人。

example.ex: ...a presidential decree nominating him as sports ambassador.
example.tran: 提名他为体育大使的总统令

gramarinfo.label: Also V n, V n to-inf

value.def: If you nominate someone to a job or position, you formally choose them to hold that job or position.

example.ex: Voters will choose fifty of the seventy five deputies. The Emir will nominate the rest...
example.tran: 选民将选出75名代表中的50名，其余代表由埃米尔任命。

example.ex: The EU would nominate two members to the committee...
example.tran: 欧盟将为该委员会指定两名成员。

example.ex: He was nominated by the African National Congress as one of its team at the Groote Sehuur talks...
example.tran: 非洲人国民大会指派他为参加格鲁特舒尔会谈的代表团成员之一。

example.ex: It is legally possible for an elderly person to nominate someone to act for them, should they become incapable of looking after themselves.
example.tran: 从法律上来说，如果老人生活不能自理，他可以指定某人为其代理事务。

gramarinfo.label: Also V n <l>as</l> n, V n n

value.def: If someone or something such as an actor or a film is nominated for an award, someone formally suggests that they should be given that award.

example.ex: Practically every movie he made was nominated for an Oscar.
example.tran: 他执导的影片几乎每部都获得过奥斯卡奖提名。

example.ex: ...a campaign to nominate the twice World Champion as Sports Personality of the Year.
example.tran: 提名那位两届世界冠军获得者为年度体育人物的拉票活动

partsOfSpeech.dec: an 无 + onym 名称，名字 + ous …的 → 没有名称的 → 匿名的
an 无 + onym 名称，名字 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 匿名
de 使… + nomin 名称，名字 + ate 使… → 使有名字 → 给…命名
hom 同 + onym 名称，名字 + ous 有…性质的，关于…的 → 同名的
ig〔= im 不〕+ nomin 名称，名字 + ious 有…性质的，关于…的 → 名声不好的 → 不光彩的，丢脸的
mis 错误 + nom 名称，名字 + er 表名词 → 误用名字 → 名字的误用
nomin 名称，名字 + al …的 → 名义上的
nomin 名称，名字 + ate 做，造成，使… → 提名；任命
nomin 名称，名字 + ee 表人 → 被提名者
patr 父亲 + onym 名称，名字 + ic …的 → 源于父名的
pseud 假 + onym 名称，名字 → 假名
syn 共同 + onym 名称，名字 → 同名 → 同义词
